content.description: Start on the left side of the wall with rails for hands and feet. Make some tricky moves up the wall with sidepulls and crimps. The crux is high up with a toss to the finish ledge. From the ledge either match and drop or top out with a couple more easier moves above. Not recommended to top out because the top is pretty high and kind of chossy.
content.location: Wall in between ADHD and Guns, Germs, and Steel

content.description:
Vestibular Sense is a balancy route that took me awhile to figure out if it could even be done. Your Vestibular Sense is what keeps you in balance. You will definitely use this on the route. 

  Vestibular Sense starts down in the depression underneath the left side of the large bulge. You start on a large ledge and boulder your way up to the large jug next to the start of the bulge. From here to the blocky top section is where it gets pretty hard. Use small crimps and pockets on the brown stain, and a lot of vestibular sense to reach the jugs on the blocks. Jug haul to the top.
content.location: Left side of the bulge. Route goes straight up where the bulge fades out.

content.description: A beautiful, completely overhung, full traverse problem with a variety of exceptional unique holds along the way. Start on the big jugular lip on the right and cross the gap to a couple of well placed sloper holds. Continue along the ridge to a nice corner hold before descending into the crux sequence. Find the outward pressure hold in the crack and leap for the corner to finish the problem. You'll never be more than 5 ft off the ground so you can easily drop off at any point in the sequence without a pad. Keep those feet up!
content.protection: None Required. A pad is nice for the end or sit start
content.location: Directly behind King of the Swingers

content.description:
The Law of Nature is a beautifully looking crack with in a fierce looking roof. 

  The line follows the crack up to the roof. It jets out from here and then boldly forges straight up.  

  A great warm-up for the much pumpy routes to its left. Offers lay-backs, hand jams, and delicate foot work getting over the roof.
content.protection: Top-Rope   You could possibly lead this but it wouldn't be well protected. I would say Top-Rope it first then lead it. You would need small cams and nuts.
content.location: Law of Nature is the obvious crack on the right hand side of the wall.

content.description:
This is one of my favorites on this wall. This route had always been a MAJOR project for me, and I spent numerous hours on it trying to figure out the moves. The special redpoint day came after I took my last finals for school at the end of the year. It just seemed right to name this the Last Final in remembrance to the last day of school and the accomplishment of climbing such a great project. 

  The route starts on a large sidepull about 5 feet left of Law of Nature. Bouldery moves lead you to the start of the overhang. Tackle some hard moves to get over the roof. From here, a big move to a flat sloper is all that prevents you from getting this powerful route.
content.protection: Top-Rope   The Last Final can be climbed from the same anchor as Law of Nature
content.location: Right side of the major roof. About 5 feet left of Law of Nature.

content.description: Start sitting on a large flat ledge and work your way up too a long lock off out of horizontal roof, gain the large pocket and continue to climb out the roof on geometric block holds and top out at the crack at the lip of the prow.
content.location: This roof is found to the left of the bulge area on the same portion of cliff about 15 yards to the north.

content.description: Start on a large horn jug at chest height, climb up the face to a pinch and then throw to a good edge.
content.location: In the center of The Bulge's roof, 10 feet to the left of The Last Final.

content.description: Start sitting on large break and climb up through the roof to a large move to a shelf, continue on good holds to the easy topout.
content.location: On the far right side of the 5.12 wall, starts on a red spray painted ADHD (hence the name) Just uphill from the Star Destroyer Boulder.

content.description: Nice roof to the north of the majority of Red Bird climbs, easier climbs on either side.  The actual Bulge looks pretty hard, on either side are some very do able climbs.  Starts are kind of bouldery.
